medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient noted a mass in her right breast 3 months prior to presentation. The lesion, initially thought to be benign, started to enlarge over the next 2 months, with concomitant redness of the overlying skin.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient underwent biopsies of a mass in the left breast at 22 years of age and of masses in the right breast at 45 years of age, which were consistent with fibroadenomas. No other relevant medical history is specified.
medical_history.family_history: Her sister had breast ductal carcinoma in situ; her mother and father had lung cancer at ages 58 and 65 years respectively; one brother had prostate cancer; both brothers had strokes in their fifth decade.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is married, works in an office, drinks less than five servings of alcohol per week, and does not smoke.
